content:
• Friday, February 16, 2018
  • IEP

    Nikkei: Icahn, Deason cut Xerox stake after Fujifilm deal

    • Carl Icahn (NYSE:IEP) and Darwin Deason -- who criticized Fujifilm's (OTCPK:FUJIY) deal to take majority control of Xerox (NYSE:XRX) and urged a vote against it -- sold part of their stakes after the deal was announced, Nikkei reports.
    • The two hold about 32M shares of Xerox, down from 40M they held in January when urging Xerox to get out of the Fuji Xerox joint venture.
    • The two might have taken profits as Xerox shares jumped 15% on Jan. 31.
    • They've initiated a proxy fight and filed suit to block the deal.
    • OTCPK:FUJIY rose 2.2% today; XRX +0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANET

    Analysts stick up for Arista; shares slide by record amount

    • Arista Networks' (NYSE:ANET) post-earnings sell-off extended to a record decline today despite a beat and healthy revenue gains -- perhaps suffering in comparison to a blowout from bigger competitor Cisco Systems (NASDAQ:CSCO).
    • Analysts stuck to their guns in the wake of the postmarket decline, particularly sticking up for an Arista outlook that many pointed to as the reason shares were selling off.
    • RBC's Mitch Steves says the forecast (for revenues of $450M-$468M, vs. consensus for $457.8M) still looks conservative and that upside from high data center expectations were likely priced in during the quarter. He still sees the company growing at 20-30% vs. a market growing in the high teens, and lowered his price target to $295, now implying 18% upside. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Morgan Stanley's James Faucette thinks there's more demand in the market than Arista can currently satisfy, a situation that can help it it beat estimates this year and next if availability improves and hyperscale cloud demand recovers.
    • UBS raised its price target to $280; Needham has said it's buying the dip with a target of $315; and Barclays has boosted its target to $329, implying 32% upside. Gabelli took the step of downgrading to Hold.
    • Arista shares fell 19% today, but still only reached their lowest close since Jan. 5. They're still up 5.9% for 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM | 60 Comments
  • LBCC

    Long Blockchain gets delisting notice from Nasdaq

    • Former beverage maker Long Blockchain (OTCPK:LBCC) says in an SEC filing that it's gotten notice of delisting from Nasdaq.
    • The move comes under discretionary authority Nasdaq has under its Rule 5101. That rule reserves authority to manage listings to "maintain the quality of and public confidence in its market, to prevent fraudulent and manipulative acts and practices, to promote just and equitable principles of trade, and to protect investors and the public interest."
    • Nasdaq also said in its notification letter that it's revoking a prior notification that the company had regained compliance with the market value of listed securities requirement.
    • The company can request a hearing no later than 4 p.m. next Thursday; it says it intends to request such a hearing.
    • And even if the appeal is approved, the company still needs to get back in compliance with the MVLS rule by April 9.
    • Shares fell 11% today; they were down 1.2% at last postmarket report.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM | 6 Comments

  • VJET

    Voxeljet -15.5% after downside guidance updates

    • Voxeljet (NYSE:VJET) updates its FY18 guidance with revenue from €28M to €30M euros, up from the previous €26M to €28M (consensus: €36.81M).
    • More guidance: Gross margin, +40%; SG&A expenses, €11M to €12M; R&D expenses, €5M to €6M; Depreciation and amortization expense, €3.75M to €4M; adjusted EBITDA, neutral-to-positive; capital expenditures, €5.5M to €6.5M. 
    • Q1 guidance has revenue from €4.5M to €5.5M (consensus: €6.83M). 
    • Voxeljet will release Q4 and FY17 results aftermarket on March 29. FY17 guidance has revenue from €22.5M to €23.5M (consensus: €29.57M) due to a weaker 1H. 
    • Voxeljet shares are down 15.5% aftermarket.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 32 Comments
  • DM

    Dominion Energy Midstream -4% as National Grid cashes out

    • Dominion Energy Midstream Partners (DM -4%) sinks to a 52-week low as National Grid (NGG +0.8%) reportedly divests its holdings in the company.
    • Sources say Deutsche Bank will reoffer ~6.8M units in a range of $25.55-$26.10/unit, a 4.4%-6.6% discount to DM's Thursday closing price.
    • DM issued the units to NGG in August 2015 to acquire a 26% ownership stake in the Iroquois Gas Transmission System; the U.K. power network operator was DM's no. 2 shareholder, below only parent Dominion Energy (D +0.4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 9 Comments
  • RIOT

    Riot Blockchain chief O'Rourke takes issue with CNBC report; shares down 38%

    • In a statement, Riot Blockchain (RIOT -37.7%) CEO John O'Rourke calls CNBC's critical report a "negative one-sided piece" that ignores his firm's many accomplishments. To wit:
    • The company entered the blockchain space via its investment in Canadian digital currency exchange Coinsquare, its 12.5% stake currently worth CAD$50M.
    • It now owns 8,000 ASIC cryptocurrency mining machines. When deployed in full, its hashing power will be over 110 Petahash of SHA 256 Bitcoin mining power and 252 Gigahash of Scrypt for Litecoin mining.
    • Letter of intent signed to acquire a CFTC-licensed registrant which will enable the company to launch a digital currency exchange and futures brokerage in the U.S.
    • Registered and acquired 500 bitcoins in the U.S. Marshals Service auction.
    • Acquired a majority interest in telecom-focused blockchain technology solutions provider Tess.
    • Beefed up management team.
    • Mr. O'Rourke explains that he adjourned the shareholders' meeting due to a lack of a quorum and expects to reconvene the meeting next quarter. As far as his stock sales are concerned, he says he sold less than 10% of his holdings at year-end 2017 to cover tax obligations.
    • Previously: CNBC investigates "questionable" Riot Blockchain; shares plummet 21.9% (Feb. 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 34 Comments
  • AUY

    Yamana Gold -10% after posting surprise Q4 loss

    • Yamana Gold (AUY -10.3%) is sharply lower after reporting a large Q4 loss vs. analyst expectations of $0.03 EPS and a slight revenue drop.
    • AUY reports Q4 production totaled 259.6K oz. from its six producing mines, as well as 1.17M oz. of silver and 34.7M lbs. of copper.
    • AUY forecasts production of 1.01M gold equiv. oz. with gold output of 900K oz. for 2018, 1.08M gold equiv. oz. for 2019, and 1.15M oz. for 2020, with gold production expected to rise mostly because of increases at Canadian Malartic, Jacobina and Minera Florida, and with new production from Cerro Moro.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 30 Comments
  • HAS

    Hasbro higher as Mattel hints at smaller focus

    • Shares of Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS) are up 2.33% as Mattel management presents to analysts ahead of the New York Toy Fair.
    • Mattel execs said the toy company plans to narrow its focus this year to focus more on improving margins, a development that could open up certain categories for Hasbro.
    • Previously: Mattel falls as execs talk strategy at New York Toy Fair (Feb. 16)

  • HII

    Huntington Ingalls hits 52-week high as Credit Suisse upgrades

    • Huntington Ingalls (NYSE:HII) advances to a 52-week high as Credit Suisse upgrades shares to Outperform from Neutral with a $335 price target, hiked from $241, believing the company is well positioned for investors even with the stock up 30% YTD.
    • Citing top-line growth, continued solid margins and the latest pension contribution and recovery guidance, Credit Suisse expects substantial EPS growth in coming years and free cash flow starting in 2019.
    • Pension income appears largely sustainable in light of HII's 2018 and 2019 guidance and similar trends seen throughout the industry, the firm says.
    • Earlier: Huntington Ingalls beats by $0.17, beats on revenue (Feb. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLD

    Cloud Peak Energy -23% as Q4 revenues, shipments sink

    • Cloud Peak Energy (CLD -22.8%) plunges despite reporting better than expected Q4 earnings, as revenue fell 6% to $214M and realized price per ton sold fell to $11.98 from $12.15 a year earlier.
    • CLD says adjusted EBITDA of $19M and shipments of 13.5M tons during Q4 both were significantly below year-ago adjusted EBITDA of $40M and shipments of 16.7M tons.
    • For 2018, CLD plans to ship 52M-56M tons, with current commitments to sell 45M tons which includes 2.5M tons contracted with export customers.
    • CLD expects 2018 capex of $15M-$25M.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 5 Comments

  • ABBV

    AbbVie's JAK1 inhibitor upadacitinib shows durable treatment effect in mid-stage Crohn's study; shares up 3%

    • Updated results from the extension portion of a Phase 2 clinical trial, CELEST, evaluating AbbVie's (ABBV +3%) JAK1 inhibitor upadacitinib in adult Crohn's disease patients who had not responded adequately to prior immunomodulator or tumor necrosis factor alpha antagonist therapy showed a sustained treatment benefit. The data are being presented at ECCO in Vienna, Austria.
    • CELEST is a 52-week randomized, double-blind trial consisting of a 16-week dose-ranging induction and a 36-week extension phase. All participants who completed the 16-week portion were re-randomized 1:1:1 to receive one of the following upadacitinib dosing regimens: 3 mg twice daily, 12 mg twice daily or 24 mg once daily for 36 weeks. The 24 mg arm was later stopped and replaced with a 6 mg twice-daily arm.
    • The co-primary endpoints were the proportion of patients achieving clinical remission and endoscopic remission up to week 16.
    • In patients who responded clinically by week 16, 41% of those receiving the 12 mg twice-daily dose achieved clinical remission at week 52. For the 3 mg, 6 mg and 24 mg arms, the rates of clinical remission were 25%, 29% and 32%, respectively.
    • The proportions who achieved endoscopic remission at week 52 in the 3 mg, 6 mg, 12 mg and 24 mg arms were 16%, 21%, 24% and 26%, respectively.
    • Upadacitinib (formerly ABT-494) is in Phase 3 development for ulcerative colitis, rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis, Crohn's disease and atopic dermatitis.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 8 Comments
  • AAPL

    GBH sets Apple target at 18.5% upside

    • GBH Insights sets its Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) price target at $205 (18.5% upside to yesterday’s close) citing the upcoming buybacks, a growing services business, and strength in China.
    • Analyst Dan Ives says the “March guidance hangover appears to have dissipated” and estimates that Apple has about 350M iPhones in the “window of opportunity” to upgrade in the next 12 to 18 months.
    • Ives expects three new iPhones this year that could capture customers scared off by the premium iPhone X.
    • The analyst predicts the services division (Music, Care, and App Store) will hit $50B in annual revenue by 2020.
    • Apple shares are up 0.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 98 Comments
  • X

    Commerce Department recommends major tariffs on steel and aluminum

    • Steel and aluminum shares are rallying as the U.S. Department of Commerce recommends tariffs: X +12.7%, AKS +12.2%, MT +3.3%, NUE +4.8%, STLD +4%, CLF +5.9%, CMC +5.4%, RS +2.4%, WOR +2.2%, TS +3.7%, TMST +6.8%, ZEUS +3.5%, SCHN +2.4%, AA +4.7%, CENX +8%, KALU +2.2%, CSTM +2.1%, ARNC +2.1%.
    • The DoC recommends a 7.7% tariff on all aluminum exports, with higher duties of 23.6% on products from China, Russian, Venezuela and Vietnam.
    • The Department also recommends global steel duties of 24% on all imports, with a ~53% tariff on steel imports from Brazil, China, India, Russia and several other countries.
    • Pres. Trump has until April 20 to make a final decision.
    • ETFs: SLX, JJU-OLD, FOIL
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 141 Comments

    Teva launches asthma treatment QVAR RediHaler in U.S.

    • Teva Pharmaceutical Industries (TEVA +1%) announces the commercial availability of QVAR RediHaler (beclomethasone dipropionate HFA) in the U.S. for the maintenance treatment of asthma in patients at least four years old.
    • The company says it will discontinue selling QVAR but RediHaler will be priced similarly.

  • NVS

    Novartis to sell U.S. generics unit - Reuters

    • Reuters reports that Novartis (NVS +0.8%), apparently out of patience with the struggling unit, is preparing to sell its U.S. generics business amidst fierce competition and downward pricing pressure.
    • Observers believe the unit could fetch $1.6B, representing an 8x multiple of EBITDA of $200M.
    • Novartis is also reportedly mulling a spin-off of eyecare unit Alcon.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 6 Comments
  • RIOT

    CNBC investigation into Riot Blockchain reveals investor with long history with tiny companies

    • CNBC reported that its inquiry into Riot Blockchain's (RIOT -31.9%) dubious history revealed the name of one Barry Honig. It seems he became active in the company when it was a veterinary testing firm called Bioptix in April 2016.
    • A prospectus filed with the SEC on August 24, 2017, showed Mr. Honig owning 543K shares and GRQ Consultants, which he founded and heads, owning 30.6K shares. His father, Alan Honig, was also on board, owning 20K shares.
    • Another investor was Mark Groussman, owner of 160K shares, who leads another consultancy called Melechdavid, owner of 340K shares.
    • Mr. Honig and Mr. Groussman have a long history together. For example, they were both involved with MusclePharm in 2012, providing services paid in stock, each accumulating a 4.2% stake. Both men also worked on a reverse merger involving American Strategic Minerals.
    • A 13G filed filed on October 11, 2017 for Riot Blockchain/F/K/A Bioptix reported a 639,920-share stake by Mr. Honig's brother Jonathan. A 13G filed two days later listed Mr. Groussman's 399,020-share stake.
    • Diligent investors will, no doubt, be looking into RIOT through a sharper lens.
    • Previously: CNBC investigates "questionable" Riot Blockchain; shares plummet 21.9% (Feb. 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 29 Comments
  • INVE

    Identiv reports preliminary Q4 & FY17 Results

    • Identive (INVE +2.6%) expects to report Q4 revenue in the range of $16.5M - $16.7M vs. a consensus of $16.55M. Net loss for the quarter is expected to be in the range between $4.3M - $4.7M. Non-GAAP adjusted EBITDA is expected in the range of $1.3M - $1.5M.
    • The resulting preliminary revenue for FY17 ranges between $60.2M - $60.4M vs. a consensus of $60.2. Net loss for the year is expected to be in the range of $7.9M - $8.3M & Non-GAAP adjusted EBITDA is expected in the range of $2.7M - $2.9M.
    • In addition, the company  has closed its previously announced acquisition of 3VR, which will strengthen the Company’s position in the premises security market.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • HHS

    Harte Hanks +2.8% as holder Fondren boosts stake, calls for changes again

    • Harte Hanks (NYSE:HHS) shareholder Fondren Management has again boosted its stake and is keeping up a call for a new chairman and a reconstituted board.
    • Shares are up 2.8%.
    • In an SEC filing, the firm and Bradley Radoff are now disclosing a stake of about 7.2%, up from about 5.9% reported Jan. 12.
    • Meanwhile, Fondren says it's had "numerous conversations with members of the Board and senior management of the Issuer and continue to demand that the chairman resign and that the Board be meaningfully reconstituted and that the Issuer adhere to best practices of corporate governance."

  • VFC

    Post-earnings decline for VF Corp

    • VF Corp (NYSE:VFC) is down 8.23% on just the slightest of a miss on both Q4 revenue and EPS.
    • Looking ahead, the retailer expects Q1 revenue of $2.90B vs. $2.95B and EPS of $0.65 vs. $0.63 consensus.
    • "We remain in the early phase of a multi-year journey to become a purpose led, agile, consumer centric organization. I am pleased with our early progress and look forward to building on our momentum in 2018," promises CEO Steve Rendle.

  • MNI

    McClatchy +1.8% as revenue beats in tough ad quarter

    • McClatchy (NYSEMKT:MNI) is up 1.8% after posting Q4 earnings where revenues declined though the company saw bright spots in subscribers and visitors.
    • Net income rose to $60.4M from $3.1M on a headline basis, but affected by numerous items including unique tax items and severance. Adjusted net income was $3.2M, down from a previous $12.9M.
    • Revenues fell 6.7% with advertising headwinds including continued print declines and a soft holiday retail ad season.
    • Total ad revenues fell 12.7%. Digital-only ad revenues were up 9.6%, and total digital ad revenues rose 1%.
    • Direct marketing ad revenues fell 9.9%, negatively impacted by Hurricane Irma.
    • For 2018, it's expecting a "milestone year" where digital ad revenues exceed those in print (which "remain volatile and are expected to decline"). Digital subs will largely offset continued declines in print circulation, leading to "low single digit revenue declines."
    • Conference call to come at noon ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • RIOT

    CNBC investigates "questionable" Riot Blockchain; shares plummet 21.9%

    • Riot Blockchain (NASDAQ:RIOT) plunges 21.9% after a CNBC investigation into the vet product company adding blockchain to its name and profiting.
    • Riot started out as Bioptix, which had a vet product patent, before making a cryptocurrency exchange investment and then purchasing a crypto mining equipment company. Riot paid $11M for $2M in equipment, according to filings.
    • CNBC says this isn’t Riot’s only “questionable” behavior: “A number of red flags in the company's SEC filings also might make investors leery: annual meetings that are postponed at the last minute, insider selling soon after the name change, dilutive issuances on favorable terms to large investors, SEC filings that are often Byzantine and, just this week, evidence that a major shareholder was getting out while everyone else was getting in.”
    • Read the full investigation here. 
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 20 Comments
  • XTNT

    Xtant Medical regains compliance with NYSE American after converting debt

    • Thinly traded micro cap Xtant Medical Holdings (XTNT +13.7%) is up a 4x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 71K shares, on the heels of its announcement that it has regained full compliance with listing requirements on NYSE American.
    • The company was deficient in total stockholders' equity which it addressed by converting certain 6.00% convertible senior unsecured notes into 2,275,745 shares of common stock on January 17, exchanging all other Notes into 10,401,309 common shares on February 14, privately placing 945,819 common shares and through its operations.
    • As of February 15, stockholders' equity was $47.4M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM

  • KAI

    More on Kadant's Q4

    • Kadant (KAI -2.2%) reports revenue rose 17% in Q4 after excluding the impact of acquisitions and foreign currency translation.
    • Papermaking Systems revenue expanded 30.4% to $112.19M.
    • Wood Processing Systems revenue grew 197.9% to $34M.
    • Revenue by Geography: North America: $68.39M (+44.2%); Europe: $44.82M (+51.3%); Asia: $24.79M (43.7%).
    • Gross margin rate squeezed 270 bps to 43.3% for the quarter.
    • Adjusted operating margin rate improved 320 bps to 13.8%.
    • Adjusted EBITDA expanded 88% to $26.5M; margin +380 bps to 17.8%.
    • Bookings for the quarter increased 29% Y/Y to $147M.
    • Q1 Guidance: Revenue: $143M to $146M; Diluted EPS: $0.77 to $0.81; Adjusted EPS: $0.94 to $0.98.
    • FY2018 Guidance: Revenue: $605M to $615M; Diluted EPS: $4.74 to $4.84; Adjusted EPS: $4.95 to $5.05.

  • NXPI

    Activist investor reaffirms $135/share price for NXP Semiconductors

    • Elliott Advisors reaffirms its fair value view that NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI) is worth $135 per share on a standalone basis.
    • The activist investor released a presentation defending its case. 
    • Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) offered $110 per share for NXP in October 2016 and the acquisition remains stuck in the regulatory process. Closing the deal would help Qualcomm defend a Broadcom takeover. 
    • NXP shares are up 0.8%.  
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 30 Comments
  • JNJ

    Johnson & Johnson's Tremfya shows sustained treatment effect in late-stage psoriasis study

    • New data from a Phase 3 clinical trial, VOYAGE 2, evaluating Johnson & Johnson (JNJ +0.9%) unit Janssen Pharmaceuticals' TREMFYA (guselkumab) in patients with moderate-to-severe plaque psoriasis showed a durable treatment effect. The results will be presented tomorrow at the American Academy of Dermatology Annual Meeting in San Diego.
    • Patients who achieved PASI 90 (90% improvement in psoriasis symptoms) at week 28 maintained their responses through week 72 with continuous treatment.
    • The majority of patients who withdrew from treatment at week 28 regained a PASI 90 response within six months of retreatment with TREMFYA.
    • Guselkumab is a human monoclonal antibody that binds to interleukin 23 (IL-23), a pro-inflammatory cytokine. It was approved in the U.S. in July 2017.
    • Previously: FDA OKs J&J's guselkumab for plaque psoriasis (July 13, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM | 6 Comments

    Needham raises LogMeIn target on top-line potential

    • Needham also likes the pending Jive acquisition to give a solid footprint in a growth market that could add 1% to 2% to the long-term top line.

    • NWL -1.99% premarket.

  • CTXR

    Citius Pharma commences late-stage study of Mino-Lok in catheter-related bloodstream infections

    • Enrollment is underway in a 700-subject Phase 3 clinical trial evaluating Citius Pharmaceuticals' (NASDAQ:CTXR) Mino-Lok in patients with catheter-related bacteremias (bloodstream infections).
    • The primary endpoint is the proportion of patients who have Overall Success at test-of-cure at week 8.
    • Mino-Lok is an antibiotic lock solution designed to salvage central venous catheters (CVCs). It contains a proprietary combination of minocycline, disodium EDTA and ethyl alcohol.
    • CVC-related infections are difficult to treat and present serious complications to patients.
    • Shares are down 25% premarket but only on 300 shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM | 2 Comments

  • QCOM

    Qualcomm still doesn't like Broadcom's offer, open to more talks

    • Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) releases a letter the company sent to Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO) following Wednesday’s meeting.
    • Qualcomm’s board says that Broadcom’s “best and final” offer of $82 per share “materially undervalues Qualcomm and has an unacceptably high level of risk, and therefore is not in the best interests of  Qualcomm stockholders.” 
    • But the board found the meeting constructive since Broadcom seemed willing to agree to antitrust-related divestitures beyond what was included in the public merger agreement. 
    • And yet: Broadcom resisted agreeing to other regulatory commitments that could be required by the FTC, European Commission, and MOFCOM, to name a few. The company wouldn’t outline its intentions for Qualcomm’s licensing business, which could cause antitrust concerns, and insists on controlling all licensing business decisions between signing and closing. 
    • Qualcomm says it remains “open to further discussions” for a better offer. 
    • Qualcomm shares are up 0.7%. 
    • Broadcom shares are up 0.5%. 
    • Previously: Qualcomm, Broadcom discuss potential deal (Feb. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM | 61 Comments

  • CPB

    More on Campbell Soup's Q2

    • Campbell Soup (NYSE:CPB) reports organic net sales declined 2% in Q2, driven primarily by lower volumes.
    • Total volume and mix slipped 2% for the period.
    • Revenue by segments: Americas simple meals and beverages: $1.2B (-2%); Global biscuits and snacks: $726M (+4%); Campbell fresh: $257M (-1%).
    • Adjusted gross margin rate down 220 bps to 35.2%, driven primarily by cost inflation and higher supply chain costs, as well as unfavorable mix.
    • Adjusted EBIT declined 80 bps to 18.4%.
    • FY2018 Guidance: Net sales: -1% to +1%; Adjusted EBIT: -7% to -5%; Adjusted EPS: $3.10 to $3.17 (+2% to +4%).
    • Denise Morrison, Campbell’s President and Chief Executive Officer, said, “This was a disappointing quarter, driven by continued challenges in U.S. soup and Campbell Fresh. The decline in organic sales was largely due to the performance of Americas Simple Meals and Beverages, where U.S. soup sales decreased by 7 percent based on the key customer issue we discussed last quarter. We are making progress with this customer and expect sales declines in soup to moderate in the second half."
    • CPB -2.73% premarket.

  • KO

    Organic revenue up 6% at Coca-Cola

    • Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO) reports unit case volume was flat in Q4.
    • Organic revenue was up 6% during the quarter.
    • Organic revenue growth by region: Europe/Middle East/Africa +8%, Latin AMerica +13%, North America +3%, Asia Pacific +1%.
    • Price/mix added four percentage points of organic growth for Coca-Cola, while concentrate sales added a percentage point.
    • Comparable operating margin expanded more than 530 basis points as the divestiture of the lower-margin bottling businesses factored in.
    • Coca-Cola says it added more "value share" in the total nonalcoholic ready-to-drink beverage category.
    • CEO update: "We achieved or exceeded our full year guidance while driving significant change as we continued to transform into a total beverage company. While there is still much work to do, I am encouraged by our momentum as we head into 2018."
    • Previously: Coca-Cola EPS in-line, beats on revenue (Feb. 16)
    • KO +1.36% premarket to $45.39.

  • SEEL

    FDA rejects Apricus Bio's ED cream Vitaros

    • Apricus Biosciences (APRI) is set for an ugly day after receiving a Complete Response Letter (CRL) from the FDA regarding its marketing application for topical erectile dysfunction (ED) cream Vitaros (alprostadil, DDAIP.HCl).
    • The CRL cited deficiencies in Chemistry, Manufacturing and Control and safety concerns specific to the 2.5% concentration of DDAIP.HCl in the current formulation.
    • CEO Richard Pascoe says, “We are disappointed with the outcome of the review given the substantial amount of CMC, clinical and non-clinical data and analysis provided to the FDA in the Vitaros resubmission. We are assessing the content of the complete response letter with our regulatory experts, including the information that may be needed to resolve the deficiencies and the time it would take to obtain such information with the goal of providing the market an update on our assessment in early March of this year."
    • Update: Trading will resume at 7:30 am ET.
    • Update: Shares are down 44% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:09 AM | 17 Comments
